subject: Creativity
title: Lennon & McCartney: Rivalry as Creative Engine
description: A micro-lesson that makes Lennon & McCartney: Rivalry as Creative Engine usable.

hook.text: Lennon wrote raw, confessional songs. McCartney wrote polished, melodic ones. Together, they changed music forever.

buildup.text: They agreed early on: every song would be credited 'Lennon-McCartney' regardless of who actually wrote it.

discovery.text: Their creative rivalry pushed each to outdo the other â€” Yesterday inspired Strawberry Fields, and the cycle continued.

twist.text: They wrote increasingly separately as tensions grew â€” but the competition kept both at their creative peak.

climax.text: The Beatles produced 213 songs in 8 years. Creative tension was the engine. When it broke, so did the band.

punchline.text: The best creative partnerships aren't harmonious. They're productive friction.
